page.title: 03Forestry Commission: FINTRY
page.content:
{The Land.} Acquired Planted
Main Block {1937 1937-53 Smallburn { " " Kirk O'Muir { " " Slafarquhar { 1960-62 1962-65 Cairnnoch Hill {1970 1970-75
{The Trees.}Heavy rainfall and exposure problems favour{Sitka spruce 85%}and { {Norway spruce 15%. Pines cover 10%.} lodgepole pine on the poorer peaty areas and Scots pine on the harder dry rocky, heathery knolls.{Larches {(mainly Japanese)}are used as fire breaks, and by road and amentity areas. There is also some{hemlock and {western red cedar.}Thinning creates windblow problems at Carron, so trees are{prematurely felled at 30 to 40 {years,}followed by replanting.
